scalf

Class Shapes

  • java.lang.Object
    • scalf.Shapes

  • public class Shapes
extends java.lang.Object
    A command line-driven program that calculates the area or volume of a two-dimensional or three-dimensional shape, respectively (See scalf.package1).

    Users are presented with a menu for selecting the different shapes. User input will determine which shape is created or to exit the program.

    Changes

    18 AUG 2020

    • Modified the logic in the getSelection() method to use the length of choices as the upper limit.
      • Since choices is shifted to align the entries with the menu number, the length of choices is equal to the last option (exit program), since "Exit the program" will always be the last menu option.
    • Modified the string for the last menu item to use the length of choices as the number. All previous numbers are used in building the earlier options.

    17 AUG 2020

    • Added runSelection(), getContinue(), and exit() methods.
      • runSelection() is a work in progress. Only case 1 is completed at this time.

    16 AUG 2020

    • Added documentation to fields and methods
    • Created the showMenu() and getSelection() methods to reduce the line-count of main

    Filename: Shapes.java

    Version:
    1.0

    • Field Detail

      • choices

        private static java.lang.String[] choices
        An array of the different available shapes used in the user interface. The first item is a blank string to line up the choices with the appropriate menu item. For instance, "Circle" is menu item 1 not 0.

      • shapes

        private static Shape[] shapes

      • cin

        private static java.util.Scanner cin

        Provides the starting point of the program. Makes calls to other methods and/or classes as necessary.
        Parameters:
        args - String array of command line arguments

      • showMenu

        private static void showMenu()
        Displays the user selection menu.

      • getSelection

        private static void getSelection()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Obtains and validates the user input.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        • InvalidSelection - User input was either not within the desired integer range or was not an integer.
        • InstantiationException - Temporary for Testing purposes.

      • runSelection

        private static void runSelection(int selection)
        Creates the appropriate Shape depending on user selection.
        Parameters:
        selection - Validated user-selection of menu item

      • getContinue

        private static boolean getContinue()
        Obtains and validates whether the user wants to continue.
        Returns:
        boolean representation of user choice

      • exit

        private static void exit()
        Outputs a message and exits the program. Output message includes the current date and time.
